publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2598 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Maggie's Centre—That the Parliament warmly congratulates the Evening Times, Glasgow, for a splendid example of positive journalism in the public interest through the editor, staff and readers, including child cancer patients, raising the remarkable sum of £500,000 to create a "Maggie’s Centre" for cancer sufferers; regards such work as a splendid example of the continuing power of Scottish journalism to change lives for the better and of the astonishing generosity of the public of Glasgow, and notes with pleasure that a fine piece of once endangered Glasgow architecture, the Victorian Gatehouse at the Western Infirmary, will be saved through becoming a "Maggie’s Centre".
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Michael Matheson*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Nora Radcliffe*, Brian Adam*, Mr John McAllion*

S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Kay Ullrich*, Michael Russell*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*, Bill Aitken*, Mary Scanlon*, Ms Sandra White*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Pauline McNeill*, Fiona McLeod*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Paul Martin*, Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Cathy Peattie*, Ms Margo MacDonald*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Des McNulty*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Elaine Smith*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Johann Lamont*
S1M-2598 Maggie's Centre (lodged on 11 January 2002) Donald Gorrie*
